   WHEREAS                                                                                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
   (A)                                                                                                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                                           The Governmeat wishes to develop the petroleum wealth of the Kurdistan Region (as            <br /><br /><br />
                                                           defined in this Contract) in a way that achieves the highest benefit to the people of the    <br /><br /><br />
                                                           Kurdistan Region and all of Iraq, using the most advanced techniques of market               <br /><br /><br />
                                                           principles and encouraging investment, consistent with the Constitution of Iraq              <br /><br /><br />
                                                           including Article 112 thereof;                                                               <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
   (B)                                                     In accordance with the Constitution of Iraq, the prevailing law of the Kurdistan             <br /><br /><br />
                                                           Region is Cite Kurdistan Region law (as defined in this Contract), except with regard        <br /><br /><br />
   tC)                                                     to a matter wholly within the exclusive jurisdiction of the Government of Iraq.              <br /><br /><br />
                                                           The Government intends to present to the National Assembly Of the Kurdistan                  <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
                                                           Region a law or laws to authorise the Government, by contract or other authorisation,        <br /><br /><br />
                                                           to exempt investors in long term projects relating to the conduct of petroleum               <br /><br /><br />
                                                           operations in the Kurdistan Region from Kurdistan Region taxation, to indemnify              <br /><br /><br />
                                                           such holders against liability to pay such taxation, and/or to guarantee the viability of    <br /><br /><br />
                                                           the applicable legal, fiscal and economic conditions of such projects; and                   <br /><br /><br />
   (D)                                                     Each Contractor Entity is u company.                                                         <br /><br /><br />
                                                           (i)    with the financial capability, and the technical knowledge and technical              <br /><br /><br />
                                                           ability, to cany out Petroleum Operations in the Contract Area (as defined in                <br /><br /><br />
                                                           this Contract) under the terms of this Contract;                                             <br /><br /><br />
                                                           (ii)    having principles of good corporate citizenship; and                                 <br /><br /><br />

   AKriCLC * - TERM or Ton CONTRACT                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
   6.1    This Contract comprises an Exploration Period and a Development Period, as defined            <br /><br /><br />
   below:                                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
   Urtwiflw Ptrlvti                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
   6.2    The Exploration Period shall be for ur initial term of five (5) Contract Years,               <br /><br /><br />
   extendable on a yearly basis (as provided in Ankles 6.5 and 6.6) up to a maximum                     <br /><br /><br />
   period of seven f7) Contract Years starting from the Effective Date The initial term                 <br /><br /><br />
   of five (5) years shall he subdivided in two sub-pennds as follows                                   <br /><br /><br />
   (a)    an initial sub-period of three (3) Contract Yean < "First Sub-Period”), and                   <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
   (b)    a second sub-period of two (2) Contract Yean ("Second Sab-Period”),                           <br /><br /><br />
   each a "‘.Sab-Period * and collectivefy "Sab-Periods**                                               <br /><br /><br />
   ll is understood that the right of the Contractor to accede to the next Sub-Period or                <br /><br /><br />
   any extension thereof pursuant to Article 6.6 shall be subject to fulfilment of the                  <br /><br /><br />
   Minimum Exploration Obligations or minimum work obligations applicable to the                        <br /><br /><br />
   previous Sub-Period or extension thereof pursuant to Article 6.6 (as the case may be).               <br /><br /><br />
   6.3    During the fxplorutMMi Period, the Coatrartor dial I pay to the fuiverwrat. in                <br /><br /><br />
   arrears, an annual surface rental for the Contract Area, as may he reduced by                        <br /><br /><br />
   relinquishment from time lo time pursuant to Article 7, of ten Dollars (US SIO) per                  <br /><br /><br />
   squire kilometre per Contract Year (“F.sploratioa Rental”) Such Exploration Rental                   <br /><br /><br />
   shall be considered as a Petroleum Cost and shall he recovered by the Coatrartor in                  <br /><br /><br />
   accordance with the provisions of Articles I and 25.                                                 <br /><br /><br />
   6.4    If the Coatrartor decides not to enter into the Second Sub-Period, it shall notify' the       <br /><br /><br />
   f Kwrmnsent at least thirty (30) days prior to the expiry of the First Sub-Period, and               <br /><br /><br />
   the Exploration Period shall expire at the end of the First Sub-Period, unless the First             <br /><br /><br />
   Sub-Period has been extended pursuant to Article 6.5 or Artkle 6.6.                                  <br /><br /><br />
   6.5    If the Contractor has fulfilled its Minimum Exploration Obligations for a Sub-Period          <br /><br /><br />
   of the Exploration Period but considers that additional work is required prior                       <br /><br /><br />
   (a)    to deciding lo submit an Appraisal Work Program and Budget as provided                        <br /><br /><br />
   under Article 12.2 in respect of a Discovery, or                                                     <br /><br /><br />
   (b)    to deciding to declare a Discovery as a Commercial Discovery in accordance                    <br /><br /><br />
   with Article 12.6(a) or 14.5(a). which additional work may include the                               <br /><br /><br />

 6.7    Subject to Article 6.4, at any time during the Exploration Period, upon thirty (30) days    <br /><br /><br />

   by the Conlrartor at least ux (6) Months before the end of the said Development                                          <br /><br /><br />

 ARTICLE !• - MINIMUM EXPLORATION WORK OBLIGATIONS                                          <br /><br /><br />
 10.1 Ihc Contractor shall start Exploration Operations within thirty (30) days of          <br /><br /><br />

 accordance with Article 8. The Contraeior shall perform geological, geophysical            <br /><br /><br />
 andfar drilling works as provided under Articles 10.2 to 10.3 (the ' Minlamm               <br /><br /><br />
 Exploration Obligations ‘). If applicable, the said Minimum Exploration Obligations        <br /><br /><br />

 petroleum industry practice.                                                               <br /><br /><br />

 ARTICLE II - EXPLORATION WORK PROGRAMS AND BUDGETS                                             <br /><br /><br />
 11.1    \k ithin forty-fix 05) day* following the Effective Dale, tfie Contractor ihall        <br /><br /><br />
 prepart and submil to the Management Committee a proposed work program and                     <br /><br /><br />
 budget relating to Exploration Operations (the ‘'Exploration Work Program a ad                 <br /><br /><br />
 Badger") for the remainder of the Calendar Year. Thereafter, no later than I October           <br /><br /><br />
 in each Calendar Year, the C oatrartor shall submit a proposed Exploration Work                <br /><br /><br />
 Program and Budget to the Management C ommittee for (he following ( alcndar Year.              <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
 11.2    Each Exploration Work Program and Budget shall include details of. but not he          <br /><br /><br />
 limited to. the following:                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
 (a)    work to be undertaken.                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
 (b)    material v goods and equipment to be acquired;                                          <br /><br /><br />
 (c)    cost estimate of services to be provided, including services by third parlies           <br /><br /><br />
 and/or Affiliated Companies of am Contractor Entity; and                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
 (d)    estimated expenditures, broken down by coal centre in accordance with the               <br /><br /><br />
 Accuunlmg Procedure.                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
 11.3    The Management Committee shall meet within sixty (60) days following its receipt of    <br /><br /><br />
 Contractor's proposal to examine and approve the Exploration Work Program and                  <br /><br /><br />
 Budget                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
 11.4    If the Gov era meal requests any modification to the Exploration Work Program and      <br /><br /><br />
 Budget, the Management Committee shall meet to discuss the Exploration Work                    <br /><br /><br />
 Program and Budget and proposed modifications thereto within the sixty <601 day                <br /><br /><br />
 penod referred to in Article 11.3 The Contractor shall communicate its csanmcttl.s             <br /><br /><br />
 on any such requested modifications to the Ciovcrnmenl at the meeting of the                   <br /><br /><br />
 Management Committee or in writing prior to such meeting.                                      <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
 11.5    The Contractor shall be authorised to make expenditures not budgeted in an             <br /><br /><br />
 approved Exploration Work Program and Budget provided that the aggregate amount                <br /><br /><br />
 of such expenditures shall not exceed ten per cent (10%) of the approved Exploration           <br /><br /><br />
 Work lYogram and Budget in any Calendar Year and provided further that such                    <br /><br /><br />
 excess expenditures shall be reported as son as is reasonably practicable to the               <br /><br /><br />
 Management Committee. Ear the avoidance of doubt all excess, expenditures shall be             <br /><br /><br />
 recovered by the Contractor in accordance with the provisions of Articles I and 25,            <br /><br /><br />
 provided that any excess expenditures above the ten per coil (10%) limit shall only be         <br /><br /><br />
 recovered with the unanimous approval of the Management Committee.                             <br /><br /><br />
 11.6    In cases of emergency. the Contractor mas incur such additional expenditures as it     <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
 deems necessary to protect life, environment or property. Such additional                      <br /><br /><br />
 expenditures shall be reported promptly to thr Management Committee For the                    <br /><br /><br />
 avoidance of doubt, such additional expenditure shall be oawkftd Petroleum € oats              <br /><br /><br />
 and shall be recovered by the Contractor in accordance with the provisions of                  <br /><br /><br />
 Articles I and 25.                                                                             <br /><br /><br />

                                 12.9    The Management Committee shall use its best efforts to approve the Development                       <br /><br /><br />
                                 Plan within sixty (60) days after its receipt of such plan. The Development Period for                       <br /><br /><br />
                                 each CommcrcaJ Discovery within a Development Plan shall be extended for the                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                 number of days in excess of such sixty (60) day period that it takes for the                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                 Management Committee to approve the Development Plan. The Development Plan                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                 shall be considered approved by the Cov era area t if the Government, through its                            <br /><br /><br />
                                 representatives on the Management Committee, indicates its approval in writing.                              <br /><br /><br />
                                 12.10    If the Govern area t requests any modifications to the Development Plan, then the                   <br /><br /><br />
                                 Management Committee shall meet within sixty (60) days of receipt by the                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 C on tractor of die Government's written notification of requested modifications                             <br /><br /><br />
                                 accompanied by all the documents justifying; such request, and shall discuss such                            <br /><br /><br />
                                 request. The Coa tractor shall communicate its comments on any such requested                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 modifications to the Government at such meeting or in writ mg prior to such meeting.                         <br /><br /><br />
                                 Any modification approved by the Management t ommittre at such meeting or within                             <br /><br /><br />
                                 a further period of thirty (30) days from the dale of such meeting shall be incorporated                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 into the Development Plan which shall then be deemed approved and adopted                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                 12.11    If the Coa tractor makes several Commercial Discoveries within the Contract Area                    <br /><br /><br />
                                 each such Commercial Discovery will have a separate Production Area. I he                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                 Contractor dull be entitled to develop and to produce cadi Commercial Discovery                              <br /><br /><br />
                                 and the Covrraareal shall provide Use appropriate Permits covering each Production                           <br /><br /><br />
                                 Area. In case the area covered by the Commercial Discovery extends beyond the                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 boundaries of the Contract Area, and to the extent such area outside the Contract Area                       <br /><br /><br />
                                 it not the subject of a Petroleum Contract (as defined in the Kurdistan Region t HI and                      <br /><br /><br />
                                 Gaa Law) with a third parly, the provisions of Article 34.2 shall apply.                                     <br /><br /><br />

                                 amount of such expenditure shall not exceed ten per cent (10%) of the approved Gas                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 Marketing W ork Program and Budget in any Calendar Year and provided further that                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                 such excess expenditures shall be reported as soon as reasonably practicable to the                               <br /><br /><br />
                                 Management Committee, h* the avoidance of doubt, all excess expenditures shall be                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                 recovered by the Contractor in accordance with the provisions of Articles I and 25.                               <br /><br /><br />
                                 provided that any excess expenditure above the ten per cent (10%) limit shall only be                             <br /><br /><br />
                                 recovered with the unanimous approval of the Management Committee.                                                <br /><br /><br />

                                 14.12    Flaring of Natural Gas in the course of activities provided for under this Contract, is                  <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                 prohibited except (i) short-term flaring up to twelve (12) Months necessary for testing                           <br /><br /><br />
                                 or other operational reasons m accordance with prudent international petroleum                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                 industry practice (which shall include the llanng of Associated Natural Gas to the                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 extent the Contractor considers that rc-aijocting Associated Natural Gas is nut                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                 justified technically and economical)} and provided the Govern meat decides not to                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 take such Associated Natural Gas), or (ii) with the prior authorisation of the                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                 Gov era meat, such authorisation not to be unreasonably withheld or delayed The                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                 Contractor shall submit such request to the (ioveraaveat. which shall include an                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                 evaluation of reasonable alternatives to flaring that have been considered along with                             <br /><br /><br />
                                 information on the amount and quality of Natural Gas involved and the duration of the                             <br /><br /><br />
                                 requested flaring.                                                                                                <br /><br /><br />

                                 ARTICLE 15- ACCOUNTING AND AUDITS                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 15.1    The Contractor shall keep in its offices in the Kurdistan Region copies of all hooks                   <br /><br /><br />
                                 and accounts of all revenue*, relating to the Petroleum Operations and all Petroleum                           <br /><br /><br />
                                 Costs (the “ArcnnatO, except during the bxptorarion Period. when the Contractor                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 shall he entitled to keep the Accounts at its headquarters Abroad. The Accounts shall                          <br /><br /><br />
                                 reflect in detail expenditure incurred as a function of the quantities and value of                            <br /><br /><br />
                                 Petroleum produced, and shall be kept for a period of five (5) years All Accounts                              <br /><br /><br />
                                 which are mode available to the Government in accordance with the provisions of                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 Ihb Contract shall be prepared at the bnglish language. The Accounts shall be kept in                          <br /><br /><br />
                                 accordance with prudent international petroleum industry practice and in accordance                            <br /><br /><br />
                                 wkh the provisions of the Accounting Procedure. The Accounts shall be kept in                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                 Dollars, which shall be the reference currency for the purposes of this Contract                               <br /><br /><br />
                                 15.2    Within ninety (90) days following the end of each C alendar Year, the Contractor                       <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 shall submit to the Gov era meat a summary statement of all Petroleum Casts incurred                           <br /><br /><br />
                                 during the said Calendar Year. The summary statement shall also include a profit                               <br /><br /><br />
                                 calculation pursuant to the provisions of Article 26                                                           <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 15.3    The Government shall have the nght:                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                 (a)    to request an audit of the Accounts with respect to each Calendar Year within                           <br /><br /><br />
                                 a period of two (2) Calendar Years follow ing the end of such Calendar Year                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                 (the '‘Aadit Request Period*'); and                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
                                 (b)    to retain an auditor of international standing familiar with international                              <br /><br /><br />
                                 petroleum industry accounting practice to undertake or assist the Government                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                 to undertake the audit                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
                                 Notwithstanding paragraphs (a) and (b) of this Article 15.3. the Government shall                              <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 have the right to audit the Accounts w ith respect to each Calendar Year al any time in                        <br /><br /><br />
                                 the case of manifest error or fraud.                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 15.4    The reasonable cost of retaining an auditor pursuant to Article 15.3 shall be home by                  <br /><br /><br />
                                 the Contractor and treated as a Petroleum Coal for the purpose of cost recovery                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 under Articles I and 25.                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                 15.5    During the Audit Request Period for any Calendar Year but not thereafter, the                          <br /><br /><br />
                                 Government, acting reasonably and in accordance with prudent international                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 petroleum industry practice, may request in writing all reasonably available                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                 information and justification* for it* audit of Petroleum Costs                                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 15.6    Should the (>o*emawat consider, on the basis of data and information available, that                   <br /><br /><br />
                                 the Contra cl or made a material mistake or there is any irregularity in respect of the                        <br /><br /><br />
                                 Accounts and considers that any corrections, adjustments or amendments should be                               <br /><br /><br />
                                 made, the (Moventmeat shall make any audit exceptions in writing and notified to the                           <br /><br /><br />
                                 ( on tractor within six (6) Months of the date of request referred k> in Article 15.3.                         <br /><br /><br />
                                 and failure to give such written exception with mi such time *hall he deemed to he an                          <br /><br /><br />
                                 acknowledgement of the correctness of the Contractor's Accounts.                                               <br /><br /><br />

                                 tnttallabara;                                                                                                 <br /><br /><br />

                                                                                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
                                 16.12    Subject to Article 43.2, in the event the production rate of the individual wells and            <br /><br /><br />
                                 Reservoir of a Petroleum Field is to be set beta* the Maximum Efficient Rate                              <br /><br /><br />
                                 rMER”) for the Reservoir, as provided for in the I development Plan, as a                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                 consequence of a decision by the timrranrsi nr any federal or international                               <br /><br /><br />
                                 regulatory body, the Government undertakes to allocate any such reduction fairly and                      <br /><br /><br />
                                 equitably among the various operators (including the Government) then producing in                        <br /><br /><br />
                                 the Kurdistan Region, pro rata their respective production rates. In such event, the                      <br /><br /><br />
                                 Government shall grant an extension of the Development Period of am Production                            <br /><br /><br />
                                 Area so affected for a reasonable period of time in order to produce the Petroleum                        <br /><br /><br />
                                 which would otherwise have already been produced, had the Ml R for the individual                         <br /><br /><br />
                                 wells and Reservoir of the Petroleum Field been maintained                                                <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
                                 Legal States                                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
                                 16.13    Ihc respective rights, duties, obligations and liabilities of the Government and the             <br /><br /><br />
                                 ( on tractor undrr this Contract are to he understood as being separate and individual                    <br /><br /><br />
                                 mid not joint and several The Parties agree that this Contract shall not create and                       <br /><br /><br />
                                 shall not be deemed to have orated a partnership or other form of association                             <br /><br /><br />
                                 between them.                                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
                                 LIWm                                                                                                      <br /><br /><br />

                                 16.14    The Government and, subject to Ankles 32.11(a) and (b). each Contractor Fatity.                  <br /><br /><br />

                                 such Contractor Fatity Such lifting agreement shall include the following:                                <br /><br /><br />

                                                       ARTICLE 17 - USE OF LAND AND EXISTING INFRASTRUCTURE                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                 17.1    The Government shall make available to the Contractor any land or property in the                    <br /><br /><br />
                                 Kurdistan Region required for the Petroleum Operations; provided, however, the                               <br /><br /><br />
                                 Contractor shall not request to use any such land unless there is a real need Cor it                         <br /><br /><br />
                                 The Coo tractor thaJI have the right to build and maintain, above and below ground,                          <br /><br /><br />
                                 any facilities required for the Petroleum Operations                                                         <br /><br /><br />
                                 17.2    If it becomes necessary for cooduct of the Petroleum Operations to occupy and use                    <br /><br /><br />
                                 any land or property in the Kurdistan Region belonging lo third parties, the                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                 Contractor shall endeavour to reach amicable agreement with the owners of such                               <br /><br /><br />
                                 if such amicable agrcrwuaM cannot he reached, the Coatractor shall notify the                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 Go* era meal On receipt of such notification:                                                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 (a) the Government shall determine the amount of compensation to he paid by                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                 the Coatractor lo the owner, if occupation will he for a short duration: or                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                 <b) the (Mwerameat shall expropriate the land or property in accordance with                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
                                 applicable Kurdistan Region Law, if such occupation will be long lasting or                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                 makes it henceforth impossible to resume original usage of such land or                                      <br /><br /><br />
                                 property. Any property rights shall he acquired by and recorded in the name                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                 of the <»•> era meat. but the Contractor shall be entitled free u«c of the land                              <br /><br /><br />
                                 or property for the Petroleum Operations for the entire duratkai of this                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 Contract                                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 The amount of the compensation in Article 17.2(a) shall he fair and reasonable, in                           <br /><br /><br />
                                 accordance with Article 29 of the Kurdistan Region CXI and Tins l aw. and shall take                         <br /><br /><br />
                                 into account the right* of the owner and any effective use of the land or property by                        <br /><br /><br />
                                 its owner at the time of occupation by the Coatractor All reasonable coats,                                  <br /><br /><br />

                                                              ARTICLE If - EQU IPMENT AND MATERIALS                                           <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
                                 19.1    The Coatraetor shall supply, or procure the supply of, all materials, equipment,                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 machinery, toot*, spare ports and any other items or goods required for the Petroleum                        <br /><br /><br />
                                 Operations ("Eqaiptaeat aad Materials )                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
                                 19.2    Said Kquipraent and Materials shall be provided by the Coatraetor in accordance                      <br /><br /><br />
                                 with the relevant Work Programs and Budgets.                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                 19.3    As soon as possible after the Effective Dale, the Contractor shall provide the                       <br /><br /><br />
                                 Management Committee with a copy of it* procedures for procurement of equipment                              <br /><br /><br />
                                 Mid Materials and/or services for the Petroleum Operations as required by the                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 provisions of Ankle 8.2(e). including the criteria for tender evaluation, which                              <br /><br /><br />
                                 procedures and criteria shall be in accordance with prudent international petroleum                          <br /><br /><br />
                                 industry practice. If the Management Committee does mg request any modifications                             <br /><br /><br />
                                 in the procurement procedures within thirty 130) days after receiving such procedures,                       <br /><br /><br />
                                 the procedures shall be deemed approved by the Management Committee.                                         <br /><br /><br />
                                 19.4    The Coatraetor shall give priority to Equipment and Materials that arc readily                       <br /><br /><br />
                                 available In the Kurdistan Region and other parts of Iraq to the extent their price,                         <br /><br /><br />
                                 grade, quality, quantity, specifications, purchase, delivery and other commercial and                        <br /><br /><br />
                                 technical terms are comparable in all material respects with those generally available                       <br /><br /><br />
                                 in the international petroleum industry                                                                      <br /><br /><br />

                                 K a tides, their Affiliates Of their Subcontractors, as the case may be.                                     <br /><br /><br />

                                 Coatraetor fir (he Petroleum Operations shall become the property of the                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 Uunmcat upon the completion of the recovery of the costs of all such Assets by                               <br /><br /><br />
                                 the Coatraetor. or the end of the Contract, whichever is the earlier.                                        <br /><br /><br />

                                                                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
                                       Each Contractor Entity shall base the exclusive right to me. free of any charge, all               <br /><br /><br />
                                       Assets described in Article 20, buth before and after recovery of the cost of the same,            <br /><br /><br />
                                       for the Petroleum Operations, as well as for any petroleum operations under other                  <br /><br /><br />
                                       agreements in the Kurdistan Region to which it or any of its Affiliates is a party,                <br /><br /><br />
                                       provided thai the Petroleum Operations take priority. The Government agrees not to                 <br /><br /><br />
                                       transfer or otherwise dispose of any of such Assets without the Contractor s prior                 <br /><br /><br />
                                       written approval                                                                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                       | he Contractor may freely move to the Contract Area any Assets from any                           <br /><br /><br />
                                       relinquished portion of the Contract Area, or from any other area in the Kurdistan                 <br /><br /><br />
                                       Region.                                                                                            <br /><br /><br />

                                                                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
                                       The Contractor shall ensure that any Subcontractors it engages have all the requisite              <br /><br /><br />
                                       experience and qualifications.                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
                                       The Contractor shall give priority to Subcontractors from the Kurdistan Region and                 <br /><br /><br />
                                       other puns of Iraq to the extent their competence, rates, experience, reputation,                  <br /><br /><br />
                                       qualifications, specialties, credit rating and terms of availability, delivery and other           <br /><br /><br />
                                       commercial terms are. in the Contractor's sole opinion, comparable in all material                 <br /><br /><br />
                                       respects with those provided by foreign companies operating in the international                   <br /><br /><br />
                                       petroleum mdirtfry. Such Subcontractors must be bona fide Kurdistan Region                         <br /><br /><br />
                                       companies not related to any Public Officer, directly’ or indirectly, and must have all            <br /><br /><br />
                                       necessary resources and capacity.                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                       Selection of Subcontractors shall take place in accordance with the procurement                    <br /><br /><br />
                                       procedures submitted by the Coatraetor to the Management Committee m                               <br /><br /><br />
                                       accordance with Article 19 1 and approved by the Management Committee.                             <br /><br /><br />
                                       The Contractor shall provide the Coveraaaeat with copies of agreements entered                     <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
                                       into with Subcontractors, where their amount exceeds the limit set by the                          <br /><br /><br />
                                       Management Committee from time to time.                                                            <br /><br /><br />

                                       The Contractor shall contribute the amount of one hundred and fifty Dollars                              <br /><br /><br />
                                       (USS150.000) in advance each Contract Year during the Exploration Period and three                       <br /><br /><br />
                                       hundred thousand Dollars (US$300,000) in advance for each C ontract Year during the                      <br /><br /><br />
                                       Development Period into the environment fund established by the Government for                           <br /><br /><br />
                                       the benefit of the natural environment of the Kurdistan Region, pursuant to the                          <br /><br /><br />
                                       Kurdistan Region Oil and Gas Law (the Lav iron meat FaatT). Such amounts shall                           <br /><br /><br />
                                       be deemed to be Petroleum Costs and shall be recovered in accordance with Articles I                     <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
                                       Any expenditure incurred by the Contractor under this Article 23 shall he considered                     <br /><br /><br />
                                       Petroleum Costs and shall be recovered in accordance with Attacks I and 25.                              <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
                              Technological aad fogtatical assistance                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
                                       Before the end of the first Contract Year, the Contractor shall provide to the                           <br /><br /><br />
                                       Government technological and logistical assistance to the Kurdistan Region                               <br /><br /><br />
                                       petroleum sector, including geological computing hardware and software and such                          <br /><br /><br />
                                       other equipment as the Minister of Natural Resources may require, up to the value of                     <br /><br /><br />
                                       one million Dollars (US$1,000,000). The form of such assistance shall be mutually                        <br /><br /><br />
                                       agreed by the Parties and any costs associated therewith shall he considered                             <br /><br /><br />
                                       Petroleum Costs and shall be recovered by the Contractor m accordance with the                           <br /><br /><br />
                                       provisions of Ankles I and 25.                                                                           <br /><br /><br />

                                             ARTICLE 26 - SHARING OF PROFIT PETROLEUM                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                             26.1    Under this Contract                                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                             (a)    Profit Petroleum means Profit Crude Oil and Profit Natural Gas;                                         <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
                                             (b)    ‘Profit Crude Oir' means the quantities of Available Crude Oil and                                      <br /><br /><br />
                                             Available Associated Natural Oas produced from the Contract Am. after the                                      <br /><br /><br />
                                             recovery of Petroleum Coats, in accordance with Articles I and 25; and                                         <br /><br /><br />
                                             (c)    “Profit Nataral Gat" means the quantities of Available Non-Associated                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                             Natural Gas produced from the Contract Area, after the recovery of Petroleum                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                             Costs in accordance with Ankles 1 and 25.                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
                                             26.2    From Firsl Production and as and when Petroleum is being produced, the C ontractor                     <br /><br /><br />
                                             shall tv entitled to take a percentage diarc of Profit Crude Oil and/or Profit Natural                         <br /><br /><br />
                                             Or in consideration for Its investment in the Petroleum Operations, which                                      <br /><br /><br />
                                             percentage share shall be determined in accordance with Article 26-5.                                          <br /><br /><br />
                                             26J To determine the percentage share of Profit Crude Oil and/or Profit Natural Gas to                         <br /><br /><br />
                                             which the Coatractor is entitled, the “R" Factor shall he calculated in accordance                             <br /><br /><br />
                                             with Article 26.4 and shall be applied to the Contract Area.                                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
                                             26.4 The “R~ Factor shall be calculated as follows:                                                            <br /><br /><br />
                                             R-X/Y                                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
                                             where                                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
                                             X:    is equal to Cumulative Revenues actually received by the Contractor.                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
                                             Y:    is equal to Cumulative Costs actually incurred by the Contractor                                         <br /><br /><br />
                                             For the purpose of this Article 26.4;                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
                                             < amwkativ« Krvcaacs" means total Revenues, as defined bekm. received by the                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                             Contractor until the end of the relevant Semester, determined in accordance with                               <br /><br /><br />
                                             Ankle 26.7.                                                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                             Reverses means the total amount actually received by the Co*tractor for recovery                               <br /><br /><br />
                                             of its Petroleum Costs and its share of Profit Petroleum in the Contract Area.                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                             “Caaraftaflve Cants" means all Petroleum Coats actually incurred pursuant to this                              <br /><br /><br />
                                             C ontract by the Contractor until the end of the relevant Semester, determined in                              <br /><br /><br />
                                             accordance with Ankle 26.7.                                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                             Notwithstanding the foregoing provisions of this Ankle 26.4. for the period from                               <br /><br /><br />
                                             First Production until the end of the Calendar Year in which fine Production occurs,                           <br /><br /><br />
                                             the IT Factor shall be deemed ui be less than one (I).                                                         <br /><br /><br />

                                 which such surrendering Party is entitled, for die avoidance of doubt, if at any time                         <br /><br /><br />

                                 ARTICLE 27 - VALUATION AND METERING OF CRUDE OIL AND NATURAL                                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                 GAS                                                             <br /><br /><br />
                                 ygjggfes                                                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                 27.1    For the purpose of this Contract, any Crude Oil produced in the Contract Area shall be                  <br /><br /><br />
                                 valued at the end of each Quarter and Month at the Delivery Point based on the                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                 International Market Price, as defined in Article 27.2.                                                         <br /><br /><br />
                                 27.2    The "laicmabonaJ Market Price" referred to in Article 27 I (hall he the weighted                        <br /><br /><br />
                                 average price per Barrel, expressed in Dollars, obtained by the Contractor at the                               <br /><br /><br />
                                 Delivery Point, by netback if necessary , during the Quarter and Month ending on the                            <br /><br /><br />
                                 Ami* of valuation for Arm's length Sales of Crude Oil.                                                          <br /><br /><br />
                                 The Contractor shall provide evidence to the (Government that the sales of Crude                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 Oil referred to m Article 27.2 are Arm’s length Saks. If the Guv era meat considers                             <br /><br /><br />
                                 that any such sak of Crude Oil is not on the bass of an Arm s Length Sale then the                              <br /><br /><br />
                                 (Government has the right to refer the matter to an expert pursuant to Article 42J.                             <br /><br /><br />
                                 In the event that there is no lifting of Crock Oil in the relevant (>iartrr and Month or                        <br /><br /><br />
                                 no Ann's length Sales, the applicable ''International Market Price" for such                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                 Quarter and Month shall be the weighted average price per Barrel obtained during that                           <br /><br /><br />
                                 Quarter and Month from Arm's Length Saks of Crude Oil of the same or similar                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                 gravity and quality from other production areas sold in markets competing with Crude                            <br /><br /><br />
                                 Oil produced from the Contract Area, taking ink) account gravity and quality                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                 differences and transportation and other post Lklivcry Point costs                                              <br /><br /><br />
                                 To determine such price, the Parties shall, prior to the commencement of Production,                            <br /><br /><br />
                                 agree on a basket of Crude Oil comparable to those produced in the Contract Area and                            <br /><br /><br />
                                 told in the international market Prion obtained shall he adjusted to account for any                            <br /><br /><br />
                                 variations such as quality, specific gravity, sulphur content, transportation costs,                            <br /><br /><br />
                                 product yield, seasonal variations in price and demand, general market trends and                               <br /><br /><br />
                                 other terms of sak.                                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                 <br /><br /><br />

                                 27 .3 The price of Natural Gas shall he the actual price obtained at the Delivers Point,              <br /><br /><br />
                                 (which may take into account quantities to be sold, quality, geographic location of                   <br /><br /><br />
                                 markets to be supplied as well as costa of production, tranqvelation and distribution                 <br /><br /><br />
                                 of Natural Gas from the Delivery Point to the relevant market, in accordance with                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 standard international petroleum industry practice). The Government shall have the                    <br /><br /><br />
                                 light to review and approve Natural Gas sales contracts.                                              <br /><br /><br />
                                 Accoaatian Statement                                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                 27.4 By the tenth (10^) day of each Month, the Contractor shall provide a statement to the            <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                 Government showing the Contractor's calculations of the value of Petroleum                            <br /><br /><br />
                                 produced and sold from the Contract Area lor the previous Month Such statement                        <br /><br /><br />
                                 shall include the following information:                                                              <br /><br /><br />
                                 (a)    quantities of Crude Oil sold by the Contractor ratifies during the                             <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                 preceding Month constituting Amt's Length Saks together with                                          <br /><br /><br />
                                 corresponding sale prices:                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
                                 (b)    quantities of Crude Oil sold by the Contractor Entities during the                             <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                 preceding Month that do not fail in (he category referred to in                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                 paragraph (a) above, together with sale prices applied during such                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                 Month:                                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 (c)    inventory in storage belonging to the Contractor ratifies at the                               <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                 beginning and at the end of the Month: and                                                            <br /><br /><br />
                                 <d) quantities of Natural Gas sold by the Contractor hntittr* and the                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                 Govern meat together with sale prices realised.                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                 Concurrently with the delivery of the monthly statement, the Contractor shall deliver                 <br /><br /><br />
                                 the Capacity Building Payment Monthly Statement lo the Government as provided in                      <br /><br /><br />
                                 Ankle 32.8(a).                                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
                                 Metering                                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                 27.5    All Export Petroleum shall be metered at the Delivery Point in accorduicc with                <br /><br /><br />
                                 prudent international petroleum aidustry practice and such meters shall be to fiscal                  <br /><br /><br />
                                 meter standards. All metering equipment shall be installed and operated by the                        <br /><br /><br />
                                 Contractor The Government shall, on receipt by the Contractor of reasonable                           <br /><br /><br />
                                 prior written notice, have the right to inspect any such metering equipment installed                 <br /><br /><br />
                                 by the Contractor, as well as all relevant documents and supporting information                       <br /><br /><br />
                                 reasonably necessary to validate the accuracy of such metering All metering                           <br /><br /><br />
                                 equipment shall be subject to periodic technical inspections in accordance with                       <br /><br /><br />
                                 prudent international petroleum industry practice.                                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                 27.6    If any metering equipment is defective, the Contractor shall use all reasonable               <br /><br /><br />
                                 endeavours k» repair it within fifteen (15) days or. If deemed necessary by the                       <br /><br /><br />
                                 Can tractor, replace it ax soon as reasonably practicable from the date the defect                    <br /><br /><br />
                                 became known The *‘Ad)m<m*ai Date" shall be the last dole that the metering                           <br /><br /><br />
                                 equipment was known or agreed to have been measuring correctly, or if not known or                    <br /><br /><br />

                                     Articles 32.8 through 32.17. he offset against any outstanding payments due by the                                                          <br /><br /><br />
                                     Government to the Contractor Entity, or paid into the bank account duly designated                                                          <br /><br /><br />
                                     by the Government in writing and shall be paid within thirty (30) days of the due                                                           <br /><br /><br />
                                     aafter which interest compounded monthly at the rale of IJBOK plus two (2)                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                     percentage points shall be applied. The right of tot-off provided in this Article 29.1                                                      <br /><br /><br />

                                             29.3    Any payment due by the Government to a Contractor Entity shall be offset against                                <br /><br /><br />
                                             future payments due by such Contractor Entity to the Governateat. or paid in                                            <br /><br /><br />
                                             Dollars to the bank account designated by the Contractor Entity in writing and shall                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                             he paid within thirty (30) days of the dale of invoke, after which interest compounded                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                             monthly at the rate of LIBOR plus two (2) percentage points shall be applied                                            <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                             29.4    Any currency conversion to be made under this Contract shall be at the exchange rate                            <br /><br /><br />
                                             of the Central Bank of Iraq, provided such exchange rate applied to the Contractor                                      <br /><br /><br />
                                             Entities shall not be less favourable than the rate offered by other private, commercial                                <br /><br /><br />
                                             or industrial banks in the international market. In the absence of the Central Bank of                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                             Iraq or in the event that the Central Honk of Iraq is unable to provide the relevant                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                             exchange rale, any currency conversion to be made under this Contract shall be at the                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                             exchange rate of a reputable commercial bank carrying on business tu the                                                <br /><br /><br />
                                             international market and approved by the Parties                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
                                             29.3 The Contractor shall not realise any gain or loss due to exchange rate fluctuations                                <br /><br /><br />
                                             and. consequently , any gain or loss resulting from the exchange of currency shall be                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                             either considered as revenue and credited to the Accounts or shall be considered as a                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                             Petroleum Cost and shall be recovered by the Contractor in accordance with Articles                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                             I and 25, as the case may be,                                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                             29.6    Each Contractor l.atity shall at all times he entitled to freely convert into Dollars or                        <br /><br /><br />
                                             am other foreign currency any Iraqi dinars received in the framework of the                                             <br /><br /><br />
                                             Petroleum Operations and to freely transfer the same Abroad. The conversion rale                                        <br /><br /><br />
                                             shall be as provided under Article 29.4.                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
                                             29.7    Each ( on tractor la lily shall have die right to be paid, receive, keep, transfer and                          <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                             use Abroad, without any restriction*, all proceeds of its share of Petroleum.                                           <br /><br /><br />
                                             29.8    Each Contractor Entity and its Subcontractors shall have the right to freely open and                           <br /><br /><br />
                                             maintain hank accounts for Petroleum Operations within or outside the Kurdistan                                         <br /><br /><br />
                                             Region and other parts of Iraq.                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
                                             29.9    Each Contractor Entity shall have the right to pay in any freely convertible currency                           <br /><br /><br />
                                             all its financial requirements for the Petroleum Operations and to convert these                                        <br /><br /><br />
                                             currencies to Iraqi dinars in any bank in the Kurdistan Region or other parts of Iraq, at                               <br /><br /><br />
                                             the same exchange rale a* provided under Article 29.4.                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                             29.10    Each Coatractor Eerily shall have the right without any restrictions, lo freely                                <br /><br /><br />
