                                                                                    ARTICLE !• - CUSTOMS PROVISIONS                                             <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
                                                   30.1    All services, material, equipment, goods, consumables and products imported into the                 <br /><br /><br />
                                                   Kurdistan Region and other pans of Iraq by the Coatractor. any Contractor Rarity,                            <br /><br /><br />
                                                   its Affiliates, any Subcontractor or any agent of any of the foregoing, for use or                           <br /><br /><br />
                                                   consumption in the Petroleum Operations shall be admitted free and exempt from any                           <br /><br /><br />
                                                   and all Taxes on import. The Coatractor. any Contractor F.atity. its Affiliates any                          <br /><br /><br />
                                                   Subcontractor or aay agent of any of the foregoing shall have the right to re-export                         <br /><br /><br />
                                                   hum the Kurdistan Region and ocher parts of Iraq fire from all Taxes on export any                           <br /><br /><br />
                                                   material, equipment goods, consumables and products that arc no lunger required for                          <br /><br /><br />
                                                   the Petroleum Operations, except where tide has passed to the (iov era meat in                               <br /><br /><br />
                                                   accordance with Article 20. in which case re-export shall be approved by the                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                                   Management Committee.                                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
                                                   30.2    The Contractor, any Contractor Rarity, its Affiliates, any Subcontractor or any                      <br /><br /><br />
                                                   agent of any of the foregoing, and their personnel (including their family members)                          <br /><br /><br />
                                                   shall have the right to frcdy import into the Kurdistan Region and other parts of Iraq                       <br /><br /><br />
                                                   and re-export from the Kurdistan Region and other parts of Iraq any personal                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                                   belongings and furniture free and exempt from any Taxes on import or export The                              <br /><br /><br />
                                                   sale in the Kurdistan Region and other parts of Iraq of personal belongings and                              <br /><br /><br />
                                                   furniture of expatriate personnel shall comply with Kurdistan Region law.                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                                   30.3    Each Contractor Ratify and its Affiliates shall be entitled to freely export from the                <br /><br /><br />
                                                   Kurdistan Region and other parts of Iraq, free of any Taxes, any Petroleum to which it                       <br /><br /><br />
                                                   is entitled pursuant to the provisions of this Contract                                                      <br /><br /><br />

                                 ARTICLE 31 - TAX PROVISIONS                                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
                                 31.1    Except as expressly provided in this Article 31. and without prejudice to the                       <br /><br /><br />
                                 exemptions expressly provided for in Article 30 and in this Article 31. each                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 Contractor Ratify. its Affiliates and any Subcontractor shall, for the entire duration                      <br /><br /><br />
                                 of this Contract, be exempt from all Taxes as a result of its income, assets and                            <br /><br /><br />
                                 activities under this Contract. The (imrranrtl shall indemnify each C oatractor                             <br /><br /><br />
                                 Rarity upon demand against any liability to pay any Taxes assessed or imposed upon                          <br /><br /><br />
                                 such entity which relate lo any of the exemptions granted by the (iovcniiartt under                         <br /><br /><br />
                                 this Article 31.1. and under Articles 31.4 to 31.11.                                                        <br /><br /><br />
                                 31.2    Each Coatractor Ratify shall be subject to corporate income tax an its income from                  <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
                                 Petroleum Operations ax provided in Article 31.3. which shall be deemed to be                               <br /><br /><br />
                                 inclusive and in hill and total discharge of any Tax on income, receipts, revenues,                         <br /><br /><br />
                                 gains or profits of each such entity. Payment of the said corporate income tax shall be                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 made fur the entire duration of this Contract directly lo the official Kurdistan Region                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 tax authorities by the Government, for the account of each Contractor Rarity, from                          <br /><br /><br />
                                 the Government's share of the Profit Petroleum received pursuant to Article 26.                             <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
                                 bach Contractor Entity shall within sixty (60) days alter the end of each tax year,                         <br /><br /><br />
                                 provide a statement to the appropriate Kurdistan Region tax authorities of its profits                      <br /><br /><br />
                                 which are subject to corporate income Utx. together w ith a calculation of the amount                       <br /><br /><br />
                                 of corporate income ux due on those profits                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                 The (imvnmnit shall, within ninety (90) days after the end of each tax year, provide                        <br /><br /><br />
                                 to each (uatracSar Entity (i) the appropriate official lax receipts from the                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 appropriate Kurdistan Region tax authorities or other relevant authority certifying the                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 payment of its corporate income tax. as determined in the said statement, mi that                           <br /><br /><br />
                                 such entity has met all its Tax obligations in the preceding tax year, and (ii) a copy of                   <br /><br /><br />
                                 any return or other filing made by the Government in respect of its payment of                              <br /><br /><br />
                                 corporate income lax on behalf of such Contractor Ratify                                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                 313 For the purposes of Article 313:                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
                                 (a) the rate of corporate income tax to be applied to each Contractor Entity                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 shall be the generally applicable rate prescribed in the law of Taxation (law                               <br /><br /><br />
                                 No. 5 of 19991 passed fay the National Assembly of the Kurdistan Region, as                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                 has been amended by Law No. 26 of 2007. and as may be amended horn lime                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 lo time or substituted in respect of Petroleum Operations (as defined under the                             <br /><br /><br />
                                 Kurdistan Region Oil and Gas law) by a petroleum operations taxation law                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                 for the Kurdistan Region, hut in no event in excess of forty per cent (40%).                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 The Panics acknowledge and agree that at the Effective Dale of this Contract                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 the corporate income tax rate b fifteen per cent (15%) for all net taxable                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                 profits.                                                                                                    <br /><br /><br />

                                                  Taxes, as referred to in Article 40 of the Kurdistan Region Oil and Gas Law or any                                <br /><br /><br />
                                                  successor Tax                                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                                  31.8    Each Contractor Entity and any Subcontractor shall he subject to the payment or                           <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                                  w ithholding of the personal income lax and social security contribution* far w hich                              <br /><br /><br />
                                                  such entity or Subcontractor is liable to pay or withhold in respect of its employees                             <br /><br /><br />
                                                  who arc Iraqi nationals, pursuant to the I aw of Taxation (Ixw So. 3 of 1999) passed                              <br /><br /><br />
                                                  by the National Assembly of the Kurdistan Region, as may be amended from time to                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                                  time, in the same manner as the same shall he generally applied to all other industries,                          <br /><br /><br />
                                                  except that a Contractor Entity or Subcontractor shall not he liable for such taxes or                            <br /><br /><br />
                                                  contributions w ith respect to employ ees of another Person.                                                      <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                                  31.9    It b acknowledged that double tax treaties will have effect to give relief from taxes to,                 <br /><br /><br />
                                                  but not limited to, the Contractor. Contractor Entities. Subcontractors and                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                                  employees and other Persons at accordance with the provisions of such double tax                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                                  treaties, but shall not impose an additional burden of taxation.                                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                                  31.10    Any value added tax ("VAT"*) shall he considered as a Petroleum Cost and shall he                        <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                                  cod recovered in accordance with the provisions of Articles I and 23.                                             <br /><br /><br />
                                                  31.11    Any value added tax (“VAT**), not otherwise recoverable by the Contractor under                          <br /><br /><br />
                                                  VAT law-, shall be considered as a Petroleum Cost and shall be cost recovered in                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                                  accordance with the provisions of Articles I and 23.                                                              <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                                  31.12    Notwithstanding any other provision to the contrary in this Contract, the Parties                        <br /><br /><br />
                                                  acknow ledge and agree that the provisions of this Article 31 shall apply individually                            <br /><br /><br />
                                                  and separately to all Contractor Entities under this Contract and that there shall be                             <br /><br /><br />
                                                  no joint and several liability in respect of any liability, duty or obligation referred to in                     <br /><br /><br />
                                                  this Article 31.                                                                                                  <br /><br /><br />

                                 entire duration of this Contract to uisc. free of charge, any pipeline and related                              <br /><br /><br />

                                 under this Ankle 33 shall be applied to the recovery of Petroleum Coats until all                               <br /><br /><br />

                                 provisions of Ankles I and 25 and shall not be included in income for corporate                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                 income tax purposes The (Government shall be entitled to receive any such tariffs                               <br /><br /><br />
                                 from third parties for their use of such pipeline and related facilities when the said                          <br /><br /><br />
                                 Pipeline Costs have been fully recovered by the Contractor The costs associated                                 <br /><br /><br />

                                 shall be considered Pipeline Costs and therefore Petroleum Costs and shall be                                   <br /><br /><br />

                                 ARTICLE 34 - l .NM LNAI ION                                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 34.1    In the event a Reservoir extends beyond the Contract Area into an adjacent area which                  <br /><br /><br />
                                 is the subject of another Petroleum Contract (as defined by the Kurdistan Region Oil                           <br /><br /><br />
                                 and Ciu Law) (an “Adjacent Contract Area‘t or in the event a Reservoir of an                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                 Adjacent Contract Area extends into the Contract Area, the provtxions of Article 47,                           <br /><br /><br />
                                 Paragraph Second of the Kurdistan Region Oil and (ias law shall apply and the                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                 Government shall require (he Contractor and the contractor of (hr Adjacent                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 Contract Area to agree upon a schedule for reaching agreement of the terms of the                              <br /><br /><br />
                                 unit nation of the Reservoir, which terms shall be based on reliable technical,                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 operational and economical parameters, all in accordance with prudent international                            <br /><br /><br />
                                 petroleum inthntry practice                                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                 In the event that the Minister of Natural Resources decides the unitisalion pursuant to                        <br /><br /><br />
                                 Article 47, Paragraph Third of the Kurdistan Region Oil and Gas Law. and if the                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 Coalraetor docs out agree with the decision of the Minister of Natural Resources, the                          <br /><br /><br />
                                 (detractor shall be entitled to arbitration pursuant to the pros ohms of Article 42.1.                         <br /><br /><br />
                                 34.2    For clarificalioo and the avoidance of doubt and notwithstanding Article 47 of the                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 Kurdistan Region Oil and Gas Law, in the event that a Reservoir extends beyond the                             <br /><br /><br />
                                 boundaries of the Contract Area into an adjacent area which is not the subject of                              <br /><br /><br />
                                 another Petroleum Contract (as defined by the Kurdistan Region Oil and Gas Law),                               <br /><br /><br />
                                 the Government shall, upon the Contractor's request, take the necessary steps to                               <br /><br /><br />
                                 extend the boundaries of Contract Area so as to include the entire Reservoir within the                        <br /><br /><br />
                                 Contract Area, provided that the Contractor can offer the Government a competitive                             <br /><br /><br />
                                 minimum work program for such adjacent area.                                                                   <br /><br /><br />

                                 ARTICLE 33 - LIABILITY AND INSURANCE                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 Contractor liability                                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
                                 33.1 Subject to the other provisions of this Contract, the Contractor, in its capacity as the                  <br /><br /><br />
                                 entity responsible lor the execution of the Petroleum Operations within the Contract                           <br /><br /><br />
                                 Area, shall be liable to third parties to the extent provided under applicable law for                         <br /><br /><br />
                                 any losses and damage it may cause u> them in conducting the Petroleum Operations.                             <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                <br /><br /><br />

                                        33.2    Notwithstanding the other provisions of this Contract the Contractor and the                               <br /><br /><br />
                                        Contractor Entities shall not be liable to the (Kncmaent or the Public Company or                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                        other government agencies, authorities nr bodies, courts or political subdivisions for                             <br /><br /><br />
                                        any damage or km or claims of any kind resulting from its conduct of the Petroleum                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                        Operations unless such damage or loss is the result of wilful misconduct Contractor                                <br /><br /><br />
                                        or a material failure to conduct Petroleum Operations in accordmscc with the terms of                              <br /><br /><br />
                                        this Contract: provided, however, that such liability cannot result in the event of any                            <br /><br /><br />
                                        omissions, errors or mistakes committed in good faith by the Contractor in the                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                        exercise of the powers and authorisations conferred upon the Contractor by virtue of                               <br /><br /><br />
                                        this Contract, and further provided that in no event shall the C ontractor and the                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                        Contractor I antic* he liable for any indirect or consequential km or damage                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                        whatsoever or any loss, damages, costs, expenses or liabilities caused (directly or                                <br /><br /><br />
                                        indirectly) by any of the following arising out of. relating to. or connected with this                            <br /><br /><br />
                                        Contract or the Petroleum Operations carried out under this Contract: (i) reservoir or                             <br /><br /><br />
                                        formation damage; (ii) inability to produce, use nr dispose of Petroleum; (iii) loan nr                            <br /><br /><br />
                                        deferment of income; (iv) special or punitive damages; or (v) other indirect damages                               <br /><br /><br />
                                        or loases whether or not similar to the foregoing.                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
                                        33.3    The Contractor shall indemnify and hold harmless the Government against all                                <br /><br /><br />
                                        losses, damages and liability arising under any claim, demand, action or proceeding                                <br /><br /><br />
                                        brought or instituted against the Government by any employee of the Contractor or                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                        of any Subcontractor or by any dependent thereof, for personal injuries, industrial                                <br /><br /><br />
                                        illness, death or damage to personal property sustained in connection with, related to                             <br /><br /><br />
                                        or arising out of the performance or non-performance of this Contract regardless of                                <br /><br /><br />
                                        the fault or negligence in whole or in party of any entity or individual.                                          <br /><br /><br />
                                        33.4    Notwithstanding Article 33.1. the Government shall indemnify and hold harmless the                         <br /><br /><br />
                                        Contractor and the Contractor Eatitic* against all losses, damages and liability                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                        arising under any claim, demand, action or proceeding brought or instituted against                                <br /><br /><br />
                                        the Contractor or any Contractor Entity by any employee of die Government or of                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                        any Public Company or of any subcontractor of the foregoing or by any dependent of                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                        any such employee, for personal injuries, industrial illness, death or damage to                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                        personal property sustained in connection with, related to or arising out of the                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                        performance or non-performance of this C ontract regardless of the fault or negligence                             <br /><br /><br />
                                        in whole or in part of any entity or individual                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
                                               The Contractor shall take all nocesoary rtcpv to respond to. and shall promptly notify                      <br /><br /><br />

                                 ARTICLE 37 - ENVIRONMENT\L PROVISIONS                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
                                 37.1    Dunrg the performance of the Petroleum Operation*, the Contractor shall take                      <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
                                 reasonable measures to ensure that it. the Operator, its Subcontractors and agents                        <br /><br /><br />
                                 attend to the protection of the em irorunent and prevention of pollution, in accordance                   <br /><br /><br />
                                 with prudem international petroleum industry practice in similar physical and                             <br /><br /><br />
                                 ecological environments and any then applicable Kurdistan Region Law.                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 37.2    Prior to surrendering a portion of the Contract Area, the Cm tractor shall take                   <br /><br /><br />
                                 reasonable measures ui abandon the area to he surrendered m accordance with prudent                       <br /><br /><br />
                                 international    petroleum    industry    practice    ui similar    physical    and ecological            <br /><br /><br />
                                 environments. Such measures shall include removal or closure in place of facilities,                      <br /><br /><br />
                                 material and equipment together with reasonable measures necessary for the                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 preservation of fauna, flora and ecosystems, all in accordance with prudent                               <br /><br /><br />
                                 international    petroleum    industry    practice    m similar    physical    and ecological             <br /><br /><br />
                                 environments. The Contractor shall only be responsible for site restoration or                            <br /><br /><br />
                                 environmental damage to the extent the same pertains solely and directly to Petroleum                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 Operations conducted pursuant to this Contract                                                            <br /><br /><br />
                                 37.3    Ihc Contractor dull take reasonable precautions and measures in accordance with                   <br /><br /><br />
                                 prudent international petroleum industry practice in similar physical and ecological                      <br /><br /><br />
                                 environments to prevent am pollution which may arise directly as a result of the                          <br /><br /><br />
                                 Petroleum Operations and to protect the environment (fauna and flora), water sources                      <br /><br /><br />
                                 and any other ndunl resources when carrying out Petroleum Operations.                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 37.4    The Contractor Uadi, in accordance with prudent international petroleum industry                  <br /><br /><br />
                                 practice in similar physical and ecological environments, respect the preservation of                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 property , agricultural areas, and fisheries, when carry ing out Petroleum Operations.                    <br /><br /><br />
                                 37.3 The Contractor shall conduct and submit an environmental anpact assessment to the                    <br /><br /><br />
                                 (.mrraairaf within six (6) months after the Effective Dale.                                               <br /><br /><br />

                                 National Parks tad Nafare Reserve Areas                                                                   <br /><br /><br />

                                       change of (he identity k> the Person who Controls a Contractor Entity (whether                                         <br /><br /><br />
                                       through merger, sale of shares or of other equity interests, or otherw ise) through a                                  <br /><br /><br />

                                       more transferees, in which the market value of such Contractor entity's participating                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                       interest (which shall he as specified in the Joint Operating Agreement relating to this                                <br /><br /><br />
                                       Contract) of where there is only one Contractor Entity, one hundred percent < 100%)                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                       in this Contract represents mure than seventy five per cent (75%) of the aggregate                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                       market value of the assets of such Contractor entity and its Affiliates that are subject                               <br /><br /><br />
                                       to the Change in Control. For the purpose of this definition "Control" means the                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                       direct or indirect ownership or control of the majuritv of the voting rights of the                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                       applicable entity at its shareholders* meetings or their equivalent; and ’aarkei                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                       '•la* ' shall be determined based upon the amount in cash a willing buyer would pay                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                       a willing seller m an Arm ’s Length transaction.                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                       Fach Contractor Fatity which is or anticipates with a reasonable degree of certainty                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                       that it will be subject to a Change in Control, other than to an Affiliated Company or a                               <br /><br /><br />
                                       Contractor Ratify, shall notify the floverameat as soon as practicable after it                                        <br /><br /><br />
                                       hecumcs aware of the Change in Control or anticipated Change in Control and request                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                       the consent of Cavern meat, which consent shall not be unreasonably delayed or                                         <br /><br /><br />
                                       withheld.                                                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
                                       A Change in Control shall not give rise to any Tax including on the consideration paid                                 <br /><br /><br />

                              ARTICLE 4* - FORCE MAJF.URF.                                                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
                              40.1    No delay, default, breach or omission of the Contractor in the execution of any of its                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
                              obligations under this Contract shall be considered a failure to perform this Contract                                          <br /><br /><br />
                              or be the sut^ect of a dispute if such delay, default, breach or omission is due to a case                                      <br /><br /><br />
                              of Force Mqjcure.                                                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
                              In such event the Contractor shall promptly notify the trover ament in writing and                                              <br /><br /><br />
                              take all reasonably appropriate measures to perform its obligations under this Contract                                         <br /><br /><br />
                              to the extent possible. The time resulting from any such delay or cuflaiimcnt in the                                            <br /><br /><br />
                              execution of such obligations, increased by the time necessary to repair any damage                                             <br /><br /><br />
                              resulting from or occurred during such delay or curtailment, shall be added to any                                              <br /><br /><br />
                              time period provided under this Contract (including the Exploration Period and any                                              <br /><br /><br />
                              extension thereto, any Sub-Period and any extension thereto and any IJcvdopmcnt                                                 <br /><br /><br />
                              Period and any extension thereto). The Panics shall meet as soon as possible after the                                          <br /><br /><br />
                              notification of Force Majeurv with a view to using reasonable endeavours to mitigate                                            <br /><br /><br />
                              the effects thereof.                                                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
                              40.2    For the purpose of this Contract, “Force Majcarr means any event that is                                                <br /><br /><br />
                              unforeseeable, insurmountable and irresistible, not due to any error or omission by the                                         <br /><br /><br />

                                             42.1 For the purpose of this Article 42.1. “Dtapate shall mean any dispute, controversy or                        <br /><br /><br />
                                             claim (of any and every kind or type, whether based on contract, tort, statute,                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                             regulation or otherwise) arising out of. relating to. or connected w ith this Contract or                         <br /><br /><br />
                                             the operations carried out under this Contract, including anv dispute as the                                      <br /><br /><br />
                                             construction, exigence, validity, interpretation, enforceability, breach or termination                           <br /><br /><br />
                                             of this Contract, which arises between the Panics (or between any one or more                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                             entities constituting the Contractor and the Government).                                                         <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
                                             This Article 42.1 does not apply to any Dilute arising out of. or relating to the                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                             exercise of rights by the Government as set forth in Articles 32.11 and 32.12. which                              <br /><br /><br />
                                             Disputes shall except only as provided in Article 32.17. be subject to the exclusive                              <br /><br /><br />
                                             jurisdiction of the courts of the Kurdistan Region located in Eibil.                                              <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
                                             In the event of a Dispute, the panics to the Dispute shall use their reasonable                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                             endeavours to negotiate promptly in good faith a mutually acceptable resolution of                                <br /><br /><br />
                                             such Dispute.                                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                             Subject to the provisions of Article 42.2, a Party who desires to submit a Dispute for                            <br /><br /><br />
                                             revolution which has not been promptly resolved a» aforesaid shall commence the                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                             dispute resolution process by providing the other ponies to the Dispute written notice                            <br /><br /><br />
                                             of the Dispute (“Notice of I>npu«c~). Ihc Notice of Dispute shall identify the parties                            <br /><br /><br />
                                             U> the Dispute, shall contain a brief statement of the nature of the Dispute and the                              <br /><br /><br />
                                             relief requested and shall request negotiations among Senior Representatives.                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                             (a) In the event that any Notice of Dispute k given in accordance with this Article                               <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
                                             42.1, the parties to the Dispute shall first seek settlement of the dispute by                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                             negotiation between Senior Representatives. "Senior Representative means                                          <br /><br /><br />
                                             any indiv iduai who has authority to negotiate the settlement of the Dispute for                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                             a party to the Dispute, which for the Oeitraacal shall mean the Minister of                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                             Natural Resources Within thirty (30) days after the date of delivery of the                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                             Notice of Dispute, the Senior Representatives representing the parties to the                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                             Dispute shall meet at a mutually acceptable date, time and place to exchange                                      <br /><br /><br />

                                                    Dispute of the Notice of Dispute or web further penod as the parties to the                                                         <br /><br /><br />

                                                    Arbitration (**LCIA") Mediation Procedure, which Procedure shall be deemed                                                          <br /><br /><br />
                                                    to he incorporated by reference into this Article, and the parties to such                                                          <br /><br /><br />

                                                    Article 42.1(b), and (B) one hundred and twenty (120) days after the delivery                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                                    of the Dispute Notice, any party to the Dispute may refer the Dispute to, and                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                                    seek final resolution by. arbitration under the IX'IA Rules, which Rules shall                                                      <br /><br /><br />
                                                    be deemed to he incorporated by reference into this Article.                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                             Any arbitration shall be conducted by three (3) arbitrators.                               <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                                                        <br /><br /><br />

                                                                                             If the parties to the Dispute arc the (•oimmril and all the                                <br /><br /><br />

                                                                                             appoint one (I) arbitrator If the parties to the Dispute are the                           <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                             Government and more than one, but not all the Contractor la tines,                         <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                             the Government shall appoint one (I) arbitrator and such Contractor                        <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                             Entities shall appoint one (I) arbitrator. If the parties to the Dispute                   <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                             arc the Government and one Contractor Eabty. the tknevnment                                <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                             and such Contractor Entity shall each appoint one (I) arbitrator.                          <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                             la any event, the two arbitrators so appointed shall in good faith, use                    <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                             all reasonable endeavours to agree on the appointment of the third                         <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                             arbitrator, who will chair the arbitral tribunal In ease of failure to                     <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                             appoint an arbitrator or to agree on the appointment of the third                          <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                             arbitrator. Rules of the LCIA shall apply.                                                 <br /><br /><br />

                                 42.2 Any disagreement between the Parties relating to Articles 15.9. 27.2 and 27.7. as well                  <br /><br /><br />
                                 as any disagreement the Parties agree to refer to an expert shall be submitted to an                         <br /><br /><br />
                                 expert, rhe Management Committee shall prepare and agree upon appropriate terms                              <br /><br /><br />
                                 of reference relating to a disagreement to be submitted to the expert in accordance                          <br /><br /><br />
                                 *«h Article 15 r terms of Reference ), as soon as possible after the Effective Date.                         <br /><br /><br />
                                 (a)    The disagreement shall he submitted to an expert appointed by mutual                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                 agreement of the Parties within thirty (30) days following the dale of                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                 preparation and agreement of the Terms of Reference by the Management                                        <br /><br /><br />
                                 Committee. If the Parties cannot agree on the choice of the expert within such                               <br /><br /><br />
                                 thirty (30) day period, at the request of either Party, the expen shall he                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                 appointed by the President of the Energy Institute in London. England. Any                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                 expert appointed must have the necessary qualifications for reviewing and                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                 deciding on the subject matter of the disagreement.                                                          <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
                                 (b)    The duties of the expert shall be stated m the Terms of Reference prepared and                        <br /><br /><br />
                                 agreed by the Management Committee. The Management Coen mince shall                                          <br /><br /><br />
                                 promptly provide the expert with the agreed Terms of Reference relating to the                               <br /><br /><br />
                                 disagreement Each Party shall have the right to give to the expert in writing                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 any information which it considers useful provided it does so within forty-five                              <br /><br /><br />
                                 (45) days after the expert's appointment Such information shall he provided                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                 to the other Party at the same time and such other Party shall be cntirled to                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 provide comments on such information to the first Party and the expen within                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                 thirty (30) days after receiving such information I he expert shall have the                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                 right to review and verify any information he deems useful to main him in his                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 review of the disagreement.                                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                 (c)    The expert shall render his decision within forty-five (45) days of his receipt                       <br /><br /><br />
                                 of the Terms of Reference and the information referred to in Article 42.2.                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                 Subject to the provisions of Article 15.9. any decision of the expert shall be                               <br /><br /><br />
                                 final and dudl not be subject to any appeal except in the ease of manifest                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                 error, fraud or malpractice. Any costs and expenses associated with the expert                               <br /><br /><br />
                                 determination shall be shared equally between the Parties.                                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                 flanal                                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
                                 42.3 Ho negotiation, mediation, arbitration or expert determination procedure under this                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 Article 42 shall exempt the Parlies from fulfilling their respective legal and/or                            <br /><br /><br />
                                 contractual obligations.                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />

                                                 ARTICLE 43 - GOVERNING LAW. FISCAL STABILITY, AMENDMENTS AND                             <br /><br /><br />
                                                                           VALIDITY                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
                                 (twcrwit Ijm                                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
                                 43.1    This Contract, including any dispute arising therefrom, thereunder ur in relation                <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
                                 thereto and the agreement to arbitrate in Article 42 . shall he governed by English law                  <br /><br /><br />
                                 (except any rule of English law which would refer the matter to another jurisdictiun),                   <br /><br /><br />
                                 together with any relevant rules, customs and practices of international law, as well an                 <br /><br /><br />
                                 by principles and practice gcnerail) accepted ta petroleum producing countries and in                    <br /><br /><br />
                                 the international petroleum industry.                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                 Fiscal Stability                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
                                 43.2    Ihc obligations of the Contractor in respect of this Contract shall not be changed by            <br /><br /><br />
                                 the (iovrrimtti and the general and overall equilibrium between the Parties under                        <br /><br /><br />
                                 this Contract shall not be affected in a substantial and lasting manner.                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
                                 43J    Ihc (iovcramcBt guarantees to the foatrartor. for the entire duration of (his                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 ( nr tract, that it will maintain the stability of the legal, fiscal and economic conditions             <br /><br /><br />
                                 of this Contract, as they result from this Contract and as they result from the laws and                 <br /><br /><br />
                                 regulations m force on the dale of signature of this Contract. Ihc Contractor has                        <br /><br /><br />
                                 entered into this Contract an the basis of the legal, fiscal and economic framework                      <br /><br /><br />
                                 prevailing at the Effective Date If. at any time after the Effective Date, there is any                  <br /><br /><br />
                                 change in the legal, fiscal amPor economic framework under the Kurdistan Region                          <br /><br /><br />
                                 law or other law applicable in or to the Kurdistan Region which detrimentally                            <br /><br /><br />
                                 affects the (oa tractor, the Contractor Entities or any other Person entitled to                         <br /><br /><br />
                                 benefits under this Contract, the terms and conditions of the Contract shall be altered                  <br /><br /><br />
                                 so as to restore the Contractor, the Contractor Parities and any other Person entitled                   <br /><br /><br />
                                 to benefits under this Contract to the same overall economic position (taking into                       <br /><br /><br />
                                 account home country taxes) as that which such Person would have been in. had no                         <br /><br /><br />
                                 such change in the legal, fiscal and/or economic framework occurred.                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 43.4 If the Contractor believes that its economic position, or the economic position of a                <br /><br /><br />
                                 Contractor Entity or any other Person entitled to benefits under this Contract, has                      <br /><br /><br />
                                 been detrimentally affected as provided in Article 43.3. upon the Contractor’s                           <br /><br /><br />
                                 written request, the Parties shall meet to agree on any necessary measures ir making                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 any appropriate amendments to the terms of this Contract to re-establishing the                          <br /><br /><br />
                                 equilibrium between the Parties and restoring the Contractor, the Contractor                             <br /><br /><br />
                                 Earitks ur any other Person entitled to benefits under this Contract to the position                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 (taking into account home country taxes) it was in prior lo the occurrence of the                        <br /><br /><br />
                                 change having such detrimental effect. Should the Parties hr unable lo agree on the                      <br /><br /><br />
                                 merit ot amending this Contract and/or on any amendments to be made lo this                              <br /><br /><br />
                                 Contract within ninety (W) days of the Contractor's request (or such other period as                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 may be agreed by the Parties), the Contractor may refer the matter in dispute to                         <br /><br /><br />
                                 arbitration as provided in Article 42.1. w ithout the necessity of first referring the                   <br /><br /><br />
                                 matter to negotiation and mediation.                                                                     <br /><br /><br />

                                 any Parly to exercise any right, power or remedy under (his Contract shall operate as a                     <br /><br /><br />

                                 ARTICLE 45 - TERMINATION                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
                                 45.1 Subject lo the precisions of Article 45.5. the Government shall have the right to                           <br /><br /><br />
                                 terminate this Contract in the event the Contractor:                                                             <br /><br /><br />
                                 (a)    fails to meet a material financial obligation esprevdy stated in this Contract; or                        <br /><br /><br />
                                 (b)    during the First Sub-Period does not earn- out drilling as detailed m Article                             <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                 10-2 or, during the Second Sub-Period (or carlicrl, does not cany out drilling,                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                 as detailed in Article 10J; or                                                                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                 (c)    interrupt* Production for a period of move than ninety (40) consecutive days                              <br /><br /><br />
                                 with no cause or justification acceptable in accordance with this Contract or                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                 under prudent intrmanonaJ petroleum industry practice, it being recognised                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                 that Force Vfajeurv is an acceptable justification for such interruptions; or                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                 (d)    intentionally extracts or produce* any mineral which a not covered by the                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                 object of this Contract unless such extraction or production is expressly                                        <br /><br /><br />
                                 authorised or unavoidable as a result of operations carried out in accordance                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                 with prudent international petroleum industry practice.                                                          <br /><br /><br />
                                 (e)    if the Coatractor comprises solely one entity, is declared bankrupt in                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                 accordance with applicable l aw; or                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
                                 (f)    wilfully refuses to abide by negotiation, mediation, arbitration or expert                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 decision under Article 42.                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                 45.2    The (iovcraaral may also terminate the Contract only in respect of one C oatraetor                       <br /><br /><br />
                                 Ratify if such enthy is subject to a Change of Control for which the (.over amea t has                           <br /><br /><br />
                                 not given its authorisation in accordance with Article 34.7.                                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 45.3    At any time prior to the Development Period, the Contractor shall have the right to                      <br /><br /><br />
                                 terminate this C ontract by surrendering the entire Contract Area in accordance with                             <br /><br /><br />
                                 the provision* of Article 7.                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 45.4    friring the Development Period, the Contractor shall have the right lo terminate this                    <br /><br /><br />
                                 Contract at any time by surrendering all Production Areax provided its then current                              <br /><br /><br />
                                 obligations have been satisfied m accordance w ith this Contract                                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                 45.5    If the C»ov rrnarai intend* to exercise its right to terminate this t on tract pursuant to               <br /><br /><br />
                                 Article 45.1. it dull first comply with the following provisions:                                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 (a) The Government shall notify the Contractor of its intention to terminate this                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 Contract stating the reasons for such termination and requesting the latter                                      <br /><br /><br />
                                 (i)    to remedy the default; or                                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                 (ii)    to propose acceptable compensation.                                                                      <br /><br /><br />

                                                                   ARTICLE 46 - APPLICATION OF CORRUPTION LAWS                                          <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
                              46.1    Each Co*tractor l athy agrees that if it it, at any time, reasonably proven to ha in                              <br /><br /><br />
                              breach of Kurdistan Region law concerning corruption any Contractor Entity ur the                                         <br /><br /><br />
                              (his era meat mas terminate this Contract in respect of the defaulting Contractor                                         <br /><br /><br />
                              Polity                                                                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
                              46.2    If this Contract is reasonably proven to have been obtained in violation of Kurdistan                             <br /><br /><br />
                              Region Law concerning corruption, this Contract it void ab imito                                                          <br /><br /><br />
                              46.3    tacb Contractor Entity and the Government agrees to comply with the United Slates                                 <br /><br /><br />
                              Foreign Corrupt Practices Act as amended from time to time.                                                               <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
                              46.4    Any Party in breach of Article 46.3 agrees that it shall be liable to the other Parties for                       <br /><br /><br />
                              any losses, expenses and damage it may cause lo them as a result of the breach of                                         <br /><br /><br />
                              Article 46.3. and shall defend, indemnify and bold harmless such Parties with respect                                     <br /><br /><br />

                                                                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
                                 paragraph i general provisions                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
                                 1.1    Purpose                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
                                 To classify expenditures, define further Petroleum Costs (in addition to those defined                  <br /><br /><br />
                                 as such in the Articles of the Contract), and prescribe the manner in which the                         <br /><br /><br />
                                 Contractor's Accounts shall be prepared and approved.                                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                 1.2    Deflations                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
                                 Wards and phrases to which a meaning has been assigned in Article I or other                            <br /><br /><br />
                                 Articles of the Contract shad have the same meaning when used in this Annex                             <br /><br /><br />
                                 1.3    lama mie ao                                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
                                 In the event of any inconsistency or conflict between the provisions of this Annex and                  <br /><br /><br />
                                 the other provisions of the Contract, then the other provisions of the Contract shall                   <br /><br /><br />
                                 prevail.                                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 1.4    Aecoaatiag Records and Reports                                                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
                                 1.4.1    The Contractor shall maintain the Accounts in accordance with Article 15.1 and in              <br /><br /><br />
                                 accordance with this Accounting Procedure, including in accordance with the charts                      <br /><br /><br />
                                 of Accounts agreed under Paragraph 1.4.2.                                                               <br /><br /><br />
                                 1.4.2    Within sixty (60) days of the Effective Dto, the Contractor shall submit to and                <br /><br /><br />
                                 discuss with the Govrraneat a proposed outline of charts of Accounts, which outline                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 shall be in accordance with generally accepted standards and recognized accounting                      <br /><br /><br />
                                 systems and consistent with normal petroleum industry practice and procedures.                          <br /><br /><br />
                                 Within ninety (40) days of receiving the above submission, the (ioveraiacat shall                       <br /><br /><br />
                                 either provide written notification of its approval of the proposal or request ui writing               <br /><br /><br />
                                 revisions to the proposal. Mrthm one hundred and eighty (180) days after the                            <br /><br /><br />
                                 Effective Date, the Contractor and the Govrraaieat shall agree on the outline of                        <br /><br /><br />
                                 charts of Accounts which shall describe the basis of the accounting system and                          <br /><br /><br />
                                 procedures to be developed and used under this Contract. Following such agreement,                      <br /><br /><br />
                                 the Contractor shall expeditiously prepare and provide the Govcraaacat with formal                      <br /><br /><br />
                                 copies of the comprehensive charts of Accounts and manuals related to the                               <br /><br /><br />
                                 accounting, recording and reporting functions, and procedures which arc. and shall be.                  <br /><br /><br />
                                 observed under the Contract                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
                                 1.4.3    V*withstanding the generality of the foregoing, the Contractor shall make regular              <br /><br /><br />
                                 Statements relating to the Petroleum Operations I hoc Statements are as shown;                          <br /><br /><br />
                                 (a) Production Statement (as indicated in Paragraph 6).                                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
