                                 1.4.4 All reports and statements shall be prepared in accordance with the Contract.                               <br /><br /><br />
                                 Kurdistan Region Law, and where there are no relevant provisions of either of these,                              <br /><br /><br />
                                 in Kcordance with prudent international petroleum industry practice.                                              <br /><br /><br />
                                 1.5    lautguge aad I ain of Account                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                 All Accounts shall be maintained and prepared in the English language and shall he                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 recorded in Dollars. Where necessary for clarification, the Contractor may «lm                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                 maintain Accounts in other currencies.                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
                                 1.6    Audit and Inspection Rights of the Government                                                              <br /><br /><br />
                                 In addition to the provisions of Articles 153 to 15.7 and 15.9. the following                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 provisions shall apply to anv audit carried out in accordance with Articles 15.3 to                               <br /><br /><br />
                                 13.7:                                                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
                                 1.6.1    For purposes of auditing, the Government. acting reasonably and in accordance with                       <br /><br /><br />
                                 prudent inicmauunal petroleum industry practice, may examine and verify, al                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                 reasonable times iqxwi reasonable prior written notice to the Contractor, ail charges                             <br /><br /><br />
                                 and credits relating to the Petroleum (>pcrat>om, such as books of account accounting                             <br /><br /><br />
                                 entries, material records and inventories, vouchers, payrolls, invoices and any other                             <br /><br /><br />
                                 documents, correspondence and records including electronic records reasonably                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 considered necessary by the (io\rrunsent in audit and verify the charges and credits,                             <br /><br /><br />
                                 values and treatments.                                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
                                 1.6.2    furthermore, the auditors shall have the right m connection with such audit to visit                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 and inspect al reasonable times, all sites, plants, facilities, warehouses and offices of                         <br /><br /><br />
                                 the Contractor directly or indirectly sewing the 1‘ctrolcum Operations and to                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 question personnel associated with those Petroleum Operations.                                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                 1.6.3    Where the Government requires verification of charges made by an Affiliated                              <br /><br /><br />
                                 Company of the Contractor, the Guv era men t shall have the right to obtain an audh                               <br /><br /><br />
                                 certificate for such changes from an internationally recognized firm of public                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                 accountants acceptable to both the < Govern meat and the Contractor, which may be                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                 the Contractor s statutory auditor.                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
                                 1.6.4    All agreed adjustments resulting from an audit shall be promptly made in the                             <br /><br /><br />
                                 Contractor's Accounts and arty consequential adjustments to payments due to the                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                 Contractor or to the Government, as the case may be. shall he made promptly                                       <br /><br /><br />

                                     All Petroleum Costs recoverable under Paragraph 3 relating to Petroleum Operations                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
                                     shall he classified, defined and allocated as set out below.                                                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />

                                                                                                                                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                             Exploration Costs are all direct and allocated indirect costs and expenditures incurred                                                                                   <br /><br /><br />
                             in carrying out the Fxploratiun Operation*, including all direct and allocated indirect                                                                                   <br /><br /><br />
                             coats and expenditures incurred m the search fur Petroleum in an area which a. or was                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
                             at the time when tuch costs and expenses were incurred, pan of the C ontract Area                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
                             including:                                                                                                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                             Aerial geophysical geochemical paleontological, geological topographical and                                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
                             seismic surveys and studies and their interpretation and purchased geological and                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
                             geophysical information.                                                                                                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                             Stratigraphic test hole drilling and water well drilling.                                                                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                             Inhour, material*, supplies, and services used in drilling and formation testing of                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                             wells with the object of finding Petroleum or Appraisal Metis excluding any costs of                                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
                             the subsequent completion of such wells as producing wells.                                                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                             facilities to the extent used in support of the purposes described in Paragraphs 2.2.                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
                             2-2.2 and 2.23. including access road*.                                                                                                                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                             That portion of all service expenditures and that portion of all general and                                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
                             administrative expenditures directly attributable to Exploration Costs or allocated                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                             thereto on a consistent and equitable basis.                                                                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                             Any other expenditure* incurred in the search for and appraisal of Petroleum after the                                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                             Effective Date and not other* nc covered under this Paragraph 2 2.                                                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                             Gas Marketing Costs arc all direct and allocated indirect costs and expenditure*                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
                             incurred in carrying out Gas Marketing Operations and include that portion of all                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
                             service expenditures and that portion of all general and administrative expenditure*                                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
                             directly attributable to Gas Marketing Costs or allocated thereto on a consistent and                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
                             equitable basis.                                                                                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />

                                 2.4.1    Drilling wells which are completed as producing wells and drilling wells for purposes                       <br /><br /><br />
                                 of producing from a Petroleum reservoir, whether these wells are dry or producing                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                 and drilling wclb for (he injection of water nr gas to enhance recovery of Petroleum                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                 2.4.2    Completing wells by way of installation of casing or equipment or otherwise after a                         <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
                                 well has been drilled for the purpose of bringing the well into use as a producing well                              <br /><br /><br />
                                 or as a well for the injection of water or gas to enhance recovers of Petroleum                                      <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
                                 2.4.3    The costs of Petroleum production. Inuispurt and storage facilities such as pipelines,                      <br /><br /><br />
                                 flow lines, production and treatment units, wellhead equipment, subsurface                                           <br /><br /><br />
                                 equipment, enhanced recovery systems. Petroleum storage facilities, and access roods                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                 for production activ ities.                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
                                 2.4.4    lingmecring and design studies lor the wells and facilities referred to in Paragraphs                       <br /><br /><br />
                                 2.4.1.2.4.2 and 2.4.3.                                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
                                 And including that portion of all service expenditures and that portion of all general                               <br /><br /><br />
                                 and administrative expenditures directly attributable to Development Costs or                                        <br /><br /><br />
                                 allocated thereto on a consistent and equitable basis: and any other expenditure                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 incurred in the Development Operations and not otherwise covered under                                               <br /><br /><br />
                                 Paragraph 2.3                                                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
                                 2.5    Production Coats                                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
                                 Production Costs are all direct and allocated indirect costs and expenditures incurred                               <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
                                 in carrying out Production Operations, including all direct and allocated Indirect coats                             <br /><br /><br />
                                 and expenses incurred in Petroleum Operations after First Production which are other                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                 than Exploration Costs, Gas Marketing Costs, Development Coats and                                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                 Decommissioning Costs. Production Coats include that portion of all service                                          <br /><br /><br />
                                 expenditures and that portion of all general and administrative expenditures directly                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 attributable to Production Coats or allocated thereto on a consistent and equitable                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                 basts.                                                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
                                 2.6    Dcvoaniissiouiug Coats                                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
                                 Decommissioning Coats arc all direct and allocated indirect coats and expenditures                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                 incurred in carrying out Decommissioning Operations and include that portion of all                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                 service expenditures and that portion of all general and administrative expenditures                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                 directly attributable to Decommissioning Costs or allocated thereto on a consistent                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                 and equitable basis, and the Decommissioning Reserve Fund shall be determined on                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 such basis, in advance of incurring such costs, as provided in Article 38 and. for the                               <br /><br /><br />
                                 purposes of cost recovery, the contributions to the Decommissioning Reserve Fund                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 shall be recovered in accordance with Article 31                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 2.7    Service Expenditure                                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
                                 Service expenditures are expenditures in support of Petroleum Operations including                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                 warehouses, vehicles, motorized rolling equipment, aircraft, fire and security stations,                             <br /><br /><br />
                                 workshop*, water and sewerage plants, power plants, housing, community and                                           <br /><br /><br />
                                 recreational facilities and furniture, tools and equipment used in these activities.                                 <br /><br /><br />

                                                                                           2.8 General aad Administrative Expenditures            <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                          General and administrative expenditures art:            <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                 2.8.1    All main office, field office and general administrative expenditures in the Kurdistan                  <br /><br /><br />
                                 Region including supervisory, accounting, procurement and employee relations                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 services.                                                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
                                 2.1.2    Where the Contractor is an Affiliate of a group of companies whose headquarters is                      <br /><br /><br />
                                 Ahmad (a Forrtga Contractor"), an annual overhead charge shall be made for                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                 services rendered (excluding the direct expenditures as referred in Paragraph                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                 3.1 _2.|b» by any Affiliate of the Foreign Contractor outside the Kurdistan Region to                            <br /><br /><br />
                                 support and manage Petroleum Operations under the Contract, or where the                                         <br /><br /><br />
                                 Contractor not being a Foreign Contractor draws upon The services of an Affiliate                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 within the Kurdistan Region, an annual overhead charge shall be made fur services                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 rendered (excluding the direct expenditures as referred in Paragraphs 3 I 2(a) and                               <br /><br /><br />
                                 (b)) by such Affiliate to support and manage Petroleum Operations under the Contract                             <br /><br /><br />
                                 (“Parent Company Overhead")                                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
                                 Parent Company Overhead will be deemed to cover the actual coat (being salaries,                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                 wages und labour burden, employee benefits, travel, hotel and other normally                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 reimbursable expenses paid by the Affiliate of a Contractor in accordance with its                               <br /><br /><br />
                                 standard personnel policy in force in the relevant period, provision of office                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                 accommodation and provision of services reasonably necessary for operation and                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                 maintaining such staff offices! incurred for services rendered by those functions of                             <br /><br /><br />
                                 Contractor's Affiliate, such as. hut not limited to. international production                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                 headquarters international exploration headquarters. treasury, payroll, taxation,                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 insurance, legal, communications, computer services, controllers, personnel,                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 executive administrative management, research and development, central engineering                               <br /><br /><br />
                                 and process engineering which:                                                                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                 (a) cannot, without unreasonable effort and'or expenditure or without the release                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 of confidential data proprietary to any of the Contractor's Affiliates, be                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                 charged under any other section of this Annex, and                                                               <br /><br /><br />
                                 <b) art property allocable to Petroleum Operations under the Contract. It is                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                 understood, however, that services performed by the departments listed above                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 ami other corporate departments which directly benefit Petroleum Operations                                      <br /><br /><br />
                                 under the Contract shall be charged as direct coos in accordance with                                            <br /><br /><br />

                                 In respect of the costs of the Contractor's Parent Company Overhead, as described                          <br /><br /><br />

                                 equal to the total of the follow mg                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
                                 2.8.2    I Expluralion Overhead                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
                                 The Contractor shall be entitled to an annual charge based on a sliding scale                              <br /><br /><br />
                                 percentage and chanted monthly to Petroleum Operations. The basis for applying this                        <br /><br /><br />
                                 percentage shall be the total of Lxploration Coats and Gas Marketing Cons during                           <br /><br /><br />
                                 each Calendar Year (exclusive of this Exploration Overhead) or fraction thereof less                       <br /><br /><br />
                                 expenditures which have been subjected U> the two (2) per cent fee. referred to in                         <br /><br /><br />
                                 Paragraph 3 I 8(b) The sliding scale percentage shall be the following:                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                 For the first four million Dollars (l IS54.000.000) four per cent (4%)                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
                                 For the next four million Dollars (US54.000.000) three per cent (3%)                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                 Over eight million Dollars (US$8,000,000) two per cent (2%)                                                <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
                                 The foregoing percentages mas be reviewed but not more often than annually, and                            <br /><br /><br />
                                 any approved appropriate adjustment shall be made, if necessary. prospectively                             <br /><br /><br />
                                 2.8.2.2    Development. Production and Decommissioning Operations Overhead                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                 The overhead rales applicable to Development. Production and Decommissioning                               <br /><br /><br />
                                 Operations shall he agreed hetween the Parties in due course and shall incorporate the                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 following guide I iacs:                                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                 (a)    The Contractor's charges must be charged as direct charges whenever                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                 possible. Overhead charges exist only to compensate the Contractor's                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                 Affiliates for costs which are property allocable to Petroleum Operations                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                 under the Contract but which cannot without unreasonable effort and/or                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 release of confidential dam proprietary to the Contractor's Affiliates, be                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                 charged under any other section. Overhead costs are billed moodily.                                        <br /><br /><br />
                                 Overhead must be commensurate with services rendered and based on actual                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                 cost studies hut may not exceed an amuunt calculated as a percentage of                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                 certain annual expenditures excluding Exploration foUi and                                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                 (b)    I hai percentage as well as the types of expenditures, which affoct overhead                        <br /><br /><br />
                                 and those, which do not. shall be agreed among the Parties.                                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 (c)    The maximum percentage rates may he revised by mutual agreement mu more                             <br /><br /><br />
                                 often than annually. The initial maximum percentage rates and the types of                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                 expenditures to which they apply shall be agreed as soon as the Parties possess                            <br /><br /><br />
                                 reasonably reliable cost estimates for the relevant Production Area.                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                 (d)    Overhead charges are nut subject to audit by Govern meat                                            <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
                                 (c) I he C ontractor shall upon request furnish al the end of each relevant                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 Calendar Year to the (wwernmeat a confirmation by its statutory auditor that                               <br /><br /><br />
                                 the overhead costs actually charged do not duplicate any other charges and                                 <br /><br /><br />

                                 inventory is taken                                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
                                 Failure of the Government u> be represented at an inventory shall bind the                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 Government to accept the inventory taken b> the Contractor                                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 The C ontractor shall clearly inform Government about the principles upon which                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 valuation of the inventory hat been based. I be Coal met or shall make every effort to                         <br /><br /><br />
                                 provide to the Govern meat a full report on such inventory within thirty (30) days of                          <br /><br /><br />
                                 the taking of the inventory. When an assiptroent of rights under the Contract takes                            <br /><br /><br />
                                 place the Contractor may. at the request of the assignee, take a special inventory                             <br /><br /><br />
                                 provided that the costs of such inventory are borne by the assignee.                                           <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 paragraph * - production statement                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
                                 6.1    Prodaetioa Information                                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                 Without prejudice to the fights and obligation of the Parties under Article 16 of the                          <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 Contract, from the date of First Production from the Contract Area the Contractor                              <br /><br /><br />
                                 shall submit a monthly production statement to the Government showing the                                      <br /><br /><br />
                                 following information separately for each producing Development Area and in                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                 aggregate for the Contract Area:                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
                                 6.1.1    The quantity of Crude Oil produced and saved.                                                         <br /><br /><br />
                                 6.1.2    The quality characteristics of such Crude Oil produced and saved.                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 6.1.3    The quantity of Natural Gas produced and saved.                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 6.1.4    The quality characteristics of such Natural fan produced and saved                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                 6.1.3 The quantities of Crude Oil and Natural Gas used lor the purposes of carrying on                         <br /><br /><br />
                                 drilling and production operations and pumping to field storage.                                               <br /><br /><br />
                                 6.1.6    The quantities ofCrude Oil and Natural Gav unavoidably lost                                           <br /><br /><br />
                                 6.1.7    The quantities of Natural Gas flared and vented.                                                      <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 6.1.8    The size of Petroleum slocks held at the beginning of the calendar Month in question.                 <br /><br /><br />
                                 6.1 9 The si/e of Petroleum slocks held at the end of the calendar Month m question.                           <br /><br /><br />
                                 6.1.10    The quantities of Natural Gas reinjected into the Reservoir.                                         <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 6.1.11    In respect of the Contract Area as a whole, the quantities of Petroleum transferred at               <br /><br /><br />
                                 the Measurement Point All quantities shown in this Statement shall he expressed in                             <br /><br /><br />
                                 both volumetric terms (Barrels of oil und cubic meters of gas) and in weight (metric                           <br /><br /><br />
                                 lames).                                                                                                        <br /><br /><br />

                                 PARAGRAPH 13 - CONTRACTOR ENTITY INCOME TAX COMPUTATION                                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                 13.1    For the purpose of Article 3l.3<b) of the C ontract, the net taxable profits of each               <br /><br /><br />
                                 ( <m tractor Entity from all the Petroleum Operations carried out under this Contract,                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 shall be calculated in accordance with this Paragraph.                                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 13.2    Each Contractor Entity shall maintain for each Calendar Year separate Accounts                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 with respect to the Petroleum Operations which shall he used, imer aha. to establish a                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 profit and loaa account and a balance sheet which will show the results of the                             <br /><br /><br />
                                 Petroleum Operations carried out in such Calendar Year as well as the assets and                           <br /><br /><br />
                                 liabilities assigned or directly related thereto. The profit and loss account will he                      <br /><br /><br />
                                 maintained under the accrual method of accounting.                                                         <br /><br /><br />
                                 13.3    For purposes of determining the net taxable profits of each Contractor Entity for                  <br /><br /><br />
                                 corporate income tax purposes                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
                                 13.3.1    the profit and loss account of such Contractor Entity shall be credited with the                 <br /><br /><br />
                                 following:                                                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                 (a)    il the Royalty is paid m cash pursuant to Article 24. revenues arising from the                     <br /><br /><br />
                                 disposal of Royalty volumes as recorded in such entity's Accounts and                                      <br /><br /><br />
                                 determined in accordance with the provisions of Article 24;                                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 (b)    revenues arising from the disposal of any Available Petroleum to which such                         <br /><br /><br />
                                 entity h entitled for recovery of its Petroleum Costs as recorded in Its                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                 Accounts and determined in accordance with the provisions of Article 25;                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                 (c)    revenues from the disposal of any Profit Petroleum to which such entity is                          <br /><br /><br />
                                 entitled under Article 26 as is recorded in its Accounts and determined in                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                 accordance with the provisions of Article 26;                                                              <br /><br /><br />
                                 (d)    any other revenues or proceeds directly connected to the Petroleum Operations                       <br /><br /><br />
                                 including those arising from the disposal of related Petroleum substances, or                              <br /><br /><br />
                                 from the treatment, storage and transportation of products for third parties:                              <br /><br /><br />
                                 (e)    any exchange gains realised or other financial income earned by such entity in                      <br /><br /><br />
                                 connection with the Petroleum Operations;                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                 13.3.2    the profit and loss account fur such Contractor Entity shall be debited with all                 <br /><br /><br />
                                 charges incurred for the purposes of the Petroleum Operations whether incurred inside                      <br /><br /><br />
                                 or outside the Kurdistan Region, which charges shall include the following:                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 (a) in addition to the charges specifically set forth below in this Paragraph, all                         <br /><br /><br />
                                 other Petroleum Coses, including (he costs of supplies, personnel and                                      <br /><br /><br />
                                 manpower expenses, and the cost of services provided to the Contractor in                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                 connection with the Petroleum Costs;                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                 <b) if the Royalty is paid in cash pursuant to Article 24. Royalty payments made                           <br /><br /><br />
                                 and as recorded in such entity's Accounts and determined in accordance with                                <br /><br /><br />
                                 the provisions of Ankle 24;                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
